title: Keeley Hawes looks moody as she films tense scene for new AIDS-era drama series Boys
text:
She's known to TV audiences for her role as DI Lindsay Denton in Line of Duty.

And Keeley Hawes has been hard at work for her latest small screen role as she filmed scenes for her new drama Boys on Rhos on Sea promenade in Wales on Tuesday.

The actress, 43, looked to be filming a tense scene for the series, set during the AIDS epidemic of the 1980s, as she appeared deep in thought while standing at the edge of the promenade.

In character: Keeley Hawes, 43, has been hard at work for her latest small screen role as she filmed scenes for her new drama Boys on Rhos on Sea promenade in Wales on Tuesday

Keeley donned a dark, knee-length coat along with a purple skirt with a pleated detail for the scene.

She added height to her frame with brown heels and also wore a multicoloured scarf and carried a red handbag.

The crew could be seen setting up the camera as they filmed Keeley standing next to the waves.

The series, created by Russell T Davies, boasts a well-known cast with Keeley acting opposite Neil Patrick Harris and Years And Years star Olly Alexander.

Show: Keeley looked to be filming a tense scene for the series, set during the AIDS epidemic of the 1980s, as she appeared deep in thought while standing at the edge of the promenade

The drama tells the story of three gay friends and what their lives were like growing up in the 80s at the time of the AIDS epidemic.

Olly, 29, plays 18-year-old Ritchie Tozer, the golden boy of the family, though he’s determined to keep secrets from them.

Keeley plays his mother, Valerie and Shaun Dooley plays Clive, his dad. The story begins in 1981 as Ritchie and his pals, Roscoe and Colin, begin a new life in London.

Strangers at first, the men and a woman named Jill become close friends.

On location: The crew could be seen setting up the camera as they filmed Keeley standing next to the waves

The story is set against the backdrop of the rise of the AIDS virus and as the decade passes the friends are determined to live and love more fiercely than ever.

Olly said: 'I feel like the luckiest boy in the world to be a part of this project, I’ve been a fan of Russell T. Davies ever since I watched Queer As Folk in secret at 14-years-old.

'His work helped shape my identity as a gay person so I’m absolutely over the moon we’ll be working together.

'The script was amazing to read, I laughed and I cried a lot, it’s a privilege to be helping to tell this story and I’m so excited.'

The show is set to air on the channel in 2020 and filming began this week.

Cast: The series, created by Russell T Davies, also stars How I Met Your Mother star Neil Patrick Harris

Russell T Davies told Variety almost five years ago that a story about Britain during the AIDS crisis had been 'building up' within him.

He said: 'It’s the kind of story that you think has been told, but then you realize it hasn’t been told in Britain. I am amazed that I haven’t written this before – I am amazed no one has.

'I think we are reaching a bit of a generational thing now where men like me in their 50s are looking back and realizing how shocking it was.'

Along with Keeley, Neil and Olly, Stephen Fry, Omari Douglas and Tracy Ann Oberman have also joined the cast.
